snippet: A judge on Tuesday will decide whether to grant the N.F.L.’s request to dismiss more than 200 cases filed by more than 4,000 former players who claim the league hid information about the dangers of head trauma.
abstract: NFL will face off in court against thousands of retirees in case that will help determine league’s role in caring for players with dementia and other neurodegenerative diseases; issue in front of federal court is whether to grant league's request to dismiss more than 200 cases brought by more than 4,000 former players who say it concealed information about dangers of head trauma.
lead_paragraph: A judge on Tuesday will decide whether to grant the N.F.L.’s request to dismiss more than 200 cases filed by more than 4,000 former players who claim the league hid information about the dangers of head trauma.

headline.seo: N.F.L., Retirees In Court Over Head Trauma Cases
headline.main: A Court Test for Suits About Head Trauma
headline.print_headline: A Court Test for Suits About Head Trauma
